description: Mock data for testing /api/v1/select and /api/v1/optimize endpoints in Postman

select_endpoint_request.job_description: We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with experience in microservices architecture, Python development, REST APIs, Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and team leadership. The ideal candidate should have experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP), database optimization, and distributed systems. Experience with machine learning is a plus.

bullets.text: Developed and maintained microservices handling 10M+ daily requests using Python, Go, and Kubernetes, ensuring 99.9% uptime
Optimized database queries and caching strategies, reducing API response time by 40% and saving $50K annually in infrastructure costs
Led a team of 3 engineers to ship a new recommendation feature that increased user engagement by 25% and generated $2M in additional revenue
Implemented comprehensive CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Docker, and Kubernetes, reducing deployment time by 60% and enabling daily releases
Designed and built RESTful and gRPC APIs serving 5M+ requests per day with sub-100ms latency, improving mobile app performance by 30%
Collaborated with product managers and designers to define technical requirements, architecture, and success metrics for new features
Mentored 2 junior engineers through code reviews, pair programming, and technical design discussions, improving team velocity by 20%
Built real-time analytics dashboard using React and WebSockets, enabling product team to monitor user behavior and make data-driven decisions
Built React components for Facebook Marketplace improving user interface accessibility and mobile responsiveness, increasing conversion rate by 15%
Implemented real-time notification system using WebSocket connections and Redis, reducing latency by 30% and improving user engagement
Optimized GraphQL API endpoints and data fetching strategies, reducing server load by 25% and improving page load times
Participated in code reviews and contributed to team best practices documentation, improving code quality and onboarding efficiency
Developed A/B testing framework for feature rollouts, enabling data-driven product decisions and reducing risk of regressions
Developed internal tools using Java and Spring Boot to automate deployment processes, reducing manual work by 40 hours per week
Built monitoring and alerting system for AWS services using CloudWatch and Lambda, improving incident detection time by 50%
Optimized database queries and implemented caching layer using DynamoDB and ElastiCache, reducing query latency by 35%
Collaborated with senior engineers on distributed systems design, learning best practices for scalability and reliability
GPA: 3.9/4.0, Magna Cum Laude, Dean's List all semesters
Relevant Coursework: Algorithms & Data Structures, Machine Learning, Distributed Systems, Database Systems, Computer Networks
Teaching Assistant for CS161 (Design and Analysis of Algorithms) - graded assignments and held office hours for 50+ students
Research Assistant in Machine Learning Lab - worked on deep learning models for computer vision applications

projects.name: Distributed Task Scheduler
projects.description: High-performance distributed task scheduling system with fault tolerance

bullets.text: Built scalable task scheduler handling 100K+ concurrent tasks using Go and Kubernetes, achieving 99.95% reliability
Implemented distributed consensus algorithm using Raft protocol for leader election and task coordination across nodes
Designed fault-tolerant architecture with automatic failover and task replication, ensuring zero data loss during node failures
Created monitoring dashboard using Prometheus and Grafana, enabling real-time visibility into system performance and health

projects.name: E-commerce Platform
projects.description: Full-stack e-commerce platform with payment integration and inventory management
projects.technologies: React, Node.js, Express, PostgreSQL, Stripe API, AWS

bullets.text: Built scalable web application supporting 1000+ concurrent users with real-time inventory updates and order processing
Integrated Stripe payment processing handling $50K+ in transactions with PCI compliance and fraud detection
Implemented JWT-based authentication and authorization with role-based access control for admin and customer roles
Deployed on AWS using EC2, RDS, S3, and CloudFront with automated backup, monitoring, and auto-scaling capabilities
Languages: Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Go, Java, C++, SQL, Bash
Frontend: React, Redux, Next.js, HTML5, CSS3, WebSocket, WebRTC
Backend: Node.js, Express, Django, Spring Boot, GraphQL, gRPC, REST APIs
Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch
DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, AWS (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda), CI/CD, Terraform
Tools: Git, GitHub, Jira, Confluence, Prometheus, Grafana, Splunk
Concepts: Microservices, Distributed Systems, System Design, Machine Learning, Data Structures & Algorithms
Google Hackathon Winner - Best Technical Implementation (2022) - Built AI-powered code review tool
Stanford Engineering Excellence Award (2021) - Top 5% of Computer Science graduating class
